issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.

fields.summary: DATEDIFF UDF fails when type is timestamp with Local timezone.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

ATTACHMENT ID: 12910938 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build
In GenericUDFDateDiff is there a reason to do new Date() on every call? date.set() was avoiding extra allocation and gc.
[~ashutoshc] the new Date() was part of this method org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.udf.generic.GenericUDFDateDiff#convertToDate  anyway. Am i missing somthing ?
This jira is resolved and released with Hive 3.0 If you find an issue with it, please create a new jira.
